hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Cliff Detection via Order Book Imbalance
hypothesis_content.statement: When top 5 bid levels contain <60% of liquidity compared to top 5 ask levels (or vice versa) during NEUTRAL regime, and 1-hour volume exceeds 20-day average by 1.5x, price breaks through thin side with 85% probability, triggering STRESS→BEAR or NEUTRAL→BULL transition depending on direction.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Asymmetric liquidity creates fragility. When volume surges into thin side, execution slippage triggers stop losses and forced liquidations that cascade into regime transitions. More reliable than pure price-based signals.
entry_conditions: Order book imbalance ratio (bids/asks) < 0.6 or > 1.67 at top 5 levels
1-hour volume > 150% of 20-day average for same period
Price tests thin side of book (within 0.5%)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price moves 2% beyond thin side OR regime changes
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Order book rebalances to ratio 0.8-1.25 within 2 hours

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If >35% of liquidity imbalances resolve via book replenishment before break, or if breaks occur but don't trigger regime changes.
